description:
The series follows the employees at the Genbu Shobou publishing company. Araki, who is a veteran editor for the dictionary department, is looking for a successor now that he's approaching retirement age. After Majime Mitsuya — a salesman who's a poor talker — meets Masashi Nishioka — Araki's coworker who is sociable and frivolous — Araki overhears their conversation and decides to recruit Majime into the department. The story follows "the awkward humans" Majime and Masashi as they work together to compile a medium-sized Japanese dictionary titled "The Great Passage" (Daitokai).

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Writing
tags.description: Centers around the profession of writing books or novels.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Office Lady
tags.description: Prominently features a female office worker or OL.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Office
tags.description: Features people who work in a business office.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/青山浩行)

Hiroyuki Aoyama is an animator. He began his career at Telecom Animation Film in 1983 before becoming a freelance artist in 2002. Aoyama is a co-recipient of the Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Special Class Animated Program at the 25th Daytime Emmy Awards for his work on The New Batman/Superman Adventures.

[Website](http://www.ike-yoshihiro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikeyoshihiro)

Yoshihiro Ike is a Japanese composer, music arranger, and bassist. He is best known for scoring and composing music for movies, TV dramas, Anime and video games and has worked on more than 100 titles in the last 20 years.

His debut anime title, [Blood: The Last Vampire](https://anilist.co/anime/405/), was nominated for the 2000 UK Music Awards under the soundtrack category, and subsequently awarded the top prize at the Japan Media Arts Festival in 2001 by the Agency for Cultural affairs. In 2006, his score for [Kamichu!](https://anilist.co/anime/489/) received an Excellence Prize at the 2005 Japan Media Arts Festival. In 2018, Shadowverse original soundtracks became the highest-ranking album on iTunes, surpassing Shallow by Lady Gaga.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](https://www.sarah-bridcutt.com/) | [Profile (EARLY WING)](https://www.earlywing.co.jp/actordb/catef/talent_bridcuttsarahemi) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/SarahBridcutt) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sarahsan_0205/) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/sarah-bridbutt.bsky.social)

A half-Australian, half-Japanese voice actress who made her debut in 2012. Her first starring role was [Asuka Kudou](https://anilist.co/character/69437) in _[Mondaiji-tachi ga Isekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo?](https://anilist.co/anime/15315)_ Since then, she’s appeared in anime, games, and Japanese dubs of western movies. She is perhaps best known for her performances as [Myne](https://anilist.co/character/129808) in _[Tate no Yuusha no Nariagari](https://anilist.co/anime/99263)_ and [Yuzuru Yamai](https://anilist.co/character/86647) in _[Date A Live](https://anilist.co/anime/15583)_.

(Source: Crunchyroll Expo 2020)

node.description:
Satsumi Matsuda is the twin sister of [Risae Matsuda](https://anilist.co/staff/119960), although Satsumi was born after midnight so they do not share birthdays. Both were the 4th and 5th Anisong Grand Prix Finalists with [Marina Kawano](https://anilist.co/staff/107072) (4th) and [Konomi Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/110607) (5th). She is affiliated with Arts Vision.
